subject: Re: Testing Private Methods
msgSnippet: ... my ... in a ... article that ... Okay then.  Is it okay if the rest of us continue the thread here in the meantime?  Or would you prefer we put it on hold
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Dave Astels <dave@s...>" <dave@s...>
wrote:
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbr@d...> wrote:
> > So said Mike Colbert <mbcolbert@y...> on 2002-12-13
>
> > >My reply was a bit hasty and poorly formed ... Let me rephrase
my
> > >question. Why is it better, easier, more practical, pragmatic,
> > >and/or more productive to not associate TestCases with classes
in a
> > >TDD environment? Or should I wait for the newsletter?
> >
> > A TestCase object is a test fixture. This is definitely an
article that
> > either Dave or I need to write.
> >
> > Dave?
>
> I have a section in the JUnit chapter in my TDD book on the topic.
> I'm thinking maybe it should be the next Coad Letter issue.
>
> I'll try to do justice to the topic once I'm back at the hotel and
> post the first draft of the results here.
>
> Dave


Okay then. Is it okay if the rest of us continue the thread here in
the meantime? Or would you prefer we put it on hold until you can
get the book written?

Thanks,
Mike
